programme.desc: A look at whether or not Area 51's notoriety acts as a cover-up to much bigger, top-secret extraterrestrial experiments taking place at multiple locations.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the top artifacts that could provide evidence that extraterrestrials once walked among us.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Model and mother Samira Frasch loves the spotlight, but when her glamorous life ends unexpectedly in her pool, investigators turn their eyes toward the web of heated relationships surrounding her family.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Beloved 60-year-old chiropractor Mary Yoder falls violently ill and is rushed to the hospital; two days later, she dies, leaving her family and friends in a state of stunned disbelief; Mary's autopsy report reveals she didn't die of natural causes.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: In February 2014, Houston police receive a tip from a conscientious bail bondsman that a murder-for-hire plot is in the works and a woman's life may be in danger.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: In 2012, 37-year-old single mother Cari Farver mysteriously vanishes into thin air; by the time police piece together the shocking, twisted truth behind her disappearance, one woman is dead and another woman stands accused of her murder.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Quasand Lewis made millions by way of drug trafficking; the federal government launched "Operation Falling Star" in order to take down 'Q' and build the largest drug related prosecution in the history of the state of Michigan.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Carlos Lehder uses the Bahamian island of Norman's Cay as a headquarters as he smuggles cocaine from Colombia to the United States.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Maria Leon commanded a reign of terror in L.A.; the criminal underworld created by her murderous brood of children.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: The Aryan Brotherhood of Texas is a white supremacist gang that boasted thousands of members inside and outside of prison throughout Texas and the United States; most of the gang's violence outside of prison is inflicted upon its own members.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: With a taste of success and the lure of easy money, Thelma started transporting cocaine and heroin between Los Angeles and Philadelphia.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Bostic's New Breeds would package and distribute heroin and defend their turf with violence.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Salvatore "Sammy the Bull" Gravano, the most notorious turncoat in mafia history, pledges loyalty to John Gotti until Gotti himself gets the Bull to change his mind.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Before he hunted down his first victim in the wilds of Alaska, Robert Hansen was a successful businessman with a family in Anchorage, but his intense feelings would build into a dark desire to exert the ultimate control over 17 victims.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Growing up gay and effeminate in the hyper masculine bayou was tough on Ronald Dominique; an inability to connect and a sexual assault in jail may have cemented his decision to kill his first victim, tragically the beginning of years of murder.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: The articulate and boastful killer is remembered for terrifying the coastal town of Santa Cruz, where he picked up and dismembered hitchhiking college students in the early 1970s.

programme.title: Surviving a Serial Killer
programme.desc: David McVicker was unaware he'd climbed into the van of murderer William Bonin when he hitchhiked home at 14 years old; David survived but was left scarred.

programme.title: Surviving a Serial Killer
programme.desc: Unaware that he was a killer, Delia Balmer begins a relationship with John Sweeney after meeting him in a pub in Camden; more than three years later, he has Delia lined up as his next victim.

programme.title: Evil Up Close: Women Who Kill
programme.desc: A trusted nanny to three young children snaps after being plagued by demonic voices, leading to devastating consequences for the family she worked for.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Erika and her boyfriend Omar plotted to kill Erika's parents and set up home as parents to her little brother.

programme.desc: The team brings in a pair of panel trucks for engine and body work.

programme.desc: A local Camaro club has brought in a few stock Camaros for modifications.

programme.desc: A '61 Eldorado convertible has some power accessories that need attention.

programme.desc: Cristy stops into the shop in the middle of a motorcycle tour of Florida.

programme.desc: The crew helps a wife track down a '67 Firebird her husband sold years ago.

programme.desc: The crew fixes the hide-away headlights and AC on a '67 Camaro RS-SS.

programme.desc: Cristy wants to get her Grandma's Grand Prix back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A man brings his dad's '82 Corvette to the shop for an interior makeover.

programme.desc: Cristy talks Rachel and Bogi into helping her restore and flip a Yamaha R6.

programme.desc: The crew takes drastic measures to seal all of a '69 Cougar's leaks.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew checks off items from a wish list for a military mom's Mustang.

programme.desc: The crew finds some parts to give a '78 Mustang some new life.

programme.desc: Bogi finds a BMW M3 she wants for herself, but it needs a lot of work.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team beefs up a Scat Pack Challenger with twin turbos and new axles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Cutlass needs a new top, plus a lot of work on the interior.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '33 Ford Roadster with a dead cylinder is getting a new 355 crate engine.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '53 F-100 on a '99 Lightning chassis has been in project mode for years.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A rare '89 Turbo Trans Am gets items knocked off the owner's wish list.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '75 El Camino swaps its bench seat for bucket seats and a center console.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2011 Jeep Wrangler is a reliable and fun vehicle to drive off to college.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team builds two Indian Scout Bobbers, each with a distinct personality.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The forgotten Mustang is back to have its leaky 302 engine replaced.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A special guest helps build a new Ford F-150 that will be sold for charity.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Polaris Slingshot and a Vanderhall are in the shop for some upgrades.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '65 C10 lowrider gets a new all-electronic 4L60E transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An autocross Malibu wagon needs work some on the steering before race day.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team retrofits a Jeepster Commando with a custom power-steering setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Lincoln gets a boost in power and fuel economy by adding EFI.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring back a vintage Jeepster Commando and convert its vintage brakes from drum to disc.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Addressing what type of maintenance is needed on a company's work truck; the girls demonstrate general maintenance, fix some broken items and give it an upgrade or two.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls tackle an incomplete, but drivable Pontiac GTO convertible by replacing the mechanics in the convertible top and putting on new exterior pieces.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2005 Jeep TJ Wrangler Rubicon is in the All Girls Garage because its owner wants to be able to use it off-road; it will need a new long arm suspension kit, new roll cage and new tires.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1966 Ford Mustang Coupe had an extensive renovation in 2009, but there are a few items that still need to be finished; the girls will address a couple of interior and exterior items to take this restoration project to the finish line.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1989 Toyota Supra has twin turbos and a potent straight 6 engine; the girls will switch out the twin turbos for a single and get more power out of the 1JZ motor; Faye's windshield gets rescued from a rock chip that could be disastrous.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1971 Pontiac LeMans is brought into the shop with an overheating issue; the crew will upgrade the car's radiator and add electric fans, then go to work replacing some worn interior parts as well.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: One of the lifters in a 1971 Chevy Camaro has stopped working; the team will have to remove the engine in order to upgrade the camshaft, lifters, bearings, and timing chain before putting it all back together.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew gets one of the first Honda Civic Type R's into the shop; the car is already a powerhouse, but it's not good enough for the track, so they will give it some modifications and upgrades to make it race-worthy.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team performs some minor repairs and adjustments to a 1966 Nova Super Sport so the owner can quickly flip it.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang brings a 1976 J10 into the garage for comparison as they personalize a 2020 Jeep Gladiator for a customer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang installs upgrades to a 2017 Ford Mustang GT they find for an empty-nester mom who is looking for some excitement in her life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Corvette gets a top-end rebuild and a factory exhaust reinstall.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2018 Kia stinger GT goes from beast to monster with aftermarket goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Oldsmobile Cutlass goes from an automatic transmission to a manual.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An '03 BMW 325i needs a timing chain and has a parasitic electrical draw.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Mustang with a supercharged engine needs more throttle response.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls find a stock Mercedes-AMG E 55 and do some European hot rodding.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An MGB with a Ford Ranger engine isn't running the correct fuel setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Camaro swaps out its 305 small block for a 383 that will make 450hp.

programme.title: Through the Storm
programme.desc: Follows the 2023 season of the Red Lake Nation (Ojibwe) high school football team. Despite dwindling interest and a two-decade-long losing record, a determined coach and group of young athletes fight to keep their football program alive. An exploration in overcoming loss, the film follows the personal triumphs and hardships of the players and their families, and how football serves as a symbol of hope, unity, and resilience for the people of Red Lake.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A cut down of the classic 1997 Daytona 500, hosted by Dale Jr., featuring fun facts and trivia about the race and pop culture in 1997.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Hosted by Dale Jr. -- Relive the race that changed NASCAR history, featuring fun facts and trivia about the race and pop culture in 1987.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: An unpredictable experiment to install lights at Charlotte Motor Speedway results in a game-changing moment for motorsports and one of the most dramatic finishes in NASCAR history.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: In the 30th Daytona 500, Bobby Allison holds off his son Davey to become the 500’s oldest winner at age 50. It is the race’s first and only father-son, one-two finish.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Built around the uncanny events of February 19, 1979, A Perfect Storm chronicles how a major blizzard created an audience for the first-ever live broadcast of the Daytona 500 and television's big gamble on the sport. Seamlessly combining a mix of the race broadcast, recently uncovered archives and news footage, plus first person accounts from the broadcasters, newsmakers, competitors and fans who experienced the day that changed NASCAR and sports broadcasting forever.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: The story of driver Davey Allison’s tumultuous attempt to win the 1992 NASCAR title.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A Perfect Storm chronicles how a major blizzard created an audience for the first-ever live broadcast of the Daytona 500 and television's big gamble on the sport.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A retrospective of the people and events that defined Charlotte Motor Speedway and it’s marquee event.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A cut down of the classic 1997 Daytona 500, hosted by Dale Jr., featuring fun facts and trivia about the race and pop culture in 1997.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Hosted by Dale Jr. -- Relive the race that changed NASCAR history, featuring fun facts and trivia about the race and pop culture in 1987.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: An unpredictable experiment to install lights at Charlotte Motor Speedway results in a game-changing moment for motorsports and one of the most dramatic finishes in NASCAR history.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: The stories of the drivers that influenced NASCAR.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: In the 30th Daytona 500, Bobby Allison holds off his son Davey to become the 500’s oldest winner at age 50. It is the race’s first and only father-son, one-two finish.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Built around the uncanny events of February 19, 1979, A Perfect Storm chronicles how a major blizzard created an audience for the first-ever live broadcast of the Daytona 500 and television's big gamble on the sport. Seamlessly combining a mix of the race broadcast, recently uncovered archives and news footage, plus first person accounts from the broadcasters, newsmakers, competitors and fans who experienced the day that changed NASCAR and sports broadcasting forever.

programme.title: World Series Film

programme.title: Great Games

programme.title: Great Games

programme.title: Great Games

programme.title: Single Bells
programme.desc: When the Bell sisters lose their family restaurant during Christmas, they hatch a plan to save it—and unexpectedly find romance along the way.

programme.title: A Very Merry New Year
programme.desc: A Fortune 500 CEO decides to gather her best high school friends for a New Year's Eve reunion celebration that winds up exposing long-hidden secrets.

programme.title: For the Love of Christmas
programme.desc: Rashad Williams faces down the pressures of making a dramatic career choice and getting married to Lauren—and all before Christmas Day.

programme.title: The Christmas Spirit
programme.desc: This Christmas, Faith is forced to choose between taking over her recently deceased father's church or handing it over to a new minister.

programme.title: A True Christmas
programme.desc: Reminded of her past, Jessica can't stand Christmas, but this holiday season has several surprises in store that will help her create new memories.

programme.title: Christmas on My Block
programme.desc: A holiday film with grit and soul as two men from very different sides of the tracks end up changing each other’s lives in permanent ways.

programme.title: Coming Home For Christmas
programme.desc: Coming from mixed backgrounds, adopted siblings Smythe, Hanna, Bea, Shane and Lonny, along with parents Pat and Samantha, will have to search for a higher spirit to get them through the holiday season.

programme.title: Endless Summer
programme.desc: A man who has been dreaming of the love of his life has one last day to be noticed by her, but his obnoxious family and her boyfriend get in the way.

programme.title: Clover
programme.desc: When her father dies shortly after his remarriage, a young African American girl struggles to cope while left in the care of her new, white stepmom.

programme.title: Single Bells
programme.desc: When the Bell sisters lose their family restaurant during Christmas, they hatch a plan to save it—and unexpectedly find romance along the way.

programme.title: Nine Lives
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity thrusts a former Special Forces agent suffering from PTSD back into the world of treachery he has tried to leave behind.

programme.title: It Ain’t Easy
programme.desc: Mack is the son of a prostitute, and has picked up the trade of becoming a pimp, until he decides to seek revenge on his enemy, Memphis Slim.

programme.title: Entanglement
programme.desc: In Atlanta, a down-on-his-luck radio DJ gets his heart broken on the air, then as his career rises, meets a caller whom he once gave romantic advice.

programme.title: A Very Merry New Year
programme.desc: A Fortune 500 CEO decides to gather her best high school friends for a New Year's Eve reunion celebration that winds up exposing long-hidden secrets.

programme.title: Animal
programme.desc: In this crime-drama starring football superstar Jim Brown, a notorious gangster must reconcile his past in order to make a future for his criminally-minded son.

programme.title: My Other Mother
programme.desc: Adopted as a child, an anchorwoman finds herself reconnecting with her birth mother and extended family while attending the funeral of her father.

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: College freshman Stacy falls for a charming grad student named Benjamin. But when he begins to physically abuse her, she looks for a way out.

programme.title: Book of Songs
programme.desc: A down on his luck musician is antagonistic to the churchgoers next door until he is introduced to the bible through music, leading to an epiphany.

programme.title: A Christmas Family Secret
programme.desc: After sacrificing family for success, a career-driven woman decides to surprise her father on Christmas and gets a surprise of her own.

programme.title: Deceitful Storm
programme.desc: A wife makes the shocking discovery that her husband is cheating on her. God can forgive him, but is he willing to atone for his sins?

programme.title: A Christmas Miracle

programme.title: She Thought

programme.title: Bars

programme.title: Three

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to Trevarrian Lodge in Newquay Cornwall, where Jean and her pro-chef husband, Dec Hegarty are hoping the food will win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Rivendell Outdoor Club, a clothing-optional resort in Wimborne, Dorset, managed by Kerry Murphy and Andy Gautry. However, not everyone is keen to let it all hang out.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition starts in Barmouth, north Wales, at the Bae Abermaw Hotel, run by newly engaged couple Rosie Lewis and Dexter Green. On arrival, guest Tracy finds herself in a hairy situation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Rigsby's Guest House in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, run by Tracy Ward. The lack of en-suite bathrooms causes a stink, and some guests cannot figure out the pricing.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Somerset Arms in Semington, Wiltshire, where John Adams is joined by friend Dennis Gowie. But cleanliness issues and thin walls gave cause for concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Cross Keys Hotel, Saffron Walden, Essex run by former flight attendant Nici Van Valen. The guests love the luxury but a mark on Tracy's towel leaves a stain on her stay and tensions are at boiling point.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: First up, Jon and Lisa welcome their rivals to the Swan Motel in Norfolk, but some of their guests find a surprise in their drawers. Later, Jon shows off his magical hosting skills on a boat tour.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michael and Scott welcome their rivals to the Hare and Hounds in Essex. They take their guests clay pigeon shooting, but Jon and Lisa find it hard to forget the feedback that their hosts gave them the day before.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sir Ben Slade welcomes his rivals to the 13th-century Maunsel House in Somerset, but the extra charge for a hot breakfast leaves some guests with a bad taste in their mouths. Meanwhile, Jon and Lisa turn detective to uncover Ben's past.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gary and Linda Kellaway welcome their rivals to Lower Keats Glamping in Devon. At dinner, Jon turns joker, but Michael and Scott have a big revelation, which is no laughing matter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four more sets of bed and breakfast owners compete, kicking off in Tyne and Wear at Tynemouth 61, owned by hospitality veteran Stephen Minns, who grew up believing he was born with blue blood.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Black Horse Inn in North Yorkshire, where unlikely double act manager Steve Barker and side-kick and bar manager Callum Dixon believe they can win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to The Shores Hotel in Blackpool, where bed and breakfast beginner Enid Hall prides herself in offering clean rooms at bargain prices. However, the guests are not as impressed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Hilltop Hideaways in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, where cousins in law Lottie and Lil Ellis are on a mission to put the glamorous in glamping.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Runswick Bay, Yorkshire and The Cliffemount Hotel, with general manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty. They hope the views be enough to wow the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Next up is the Quayside Hotel in Boston, Lincolnshire, run by Alistair and partner Lana, where most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels stuck in a neon nightmare.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, run by couple Claire and Adam. Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers, but the other guests are shocked by their surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Swan House in Kelvedon, Essex, where owner Daniele is joined by sister Chantal. On arrival, the traditional décor impresses, but Lana is left with wardrobe woes.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire run by colleagues Genice Hall and Cathy Hudson. There's a battle of the breakfasts, and feedback that cuts deep.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Railway Inn near Hull, run by couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize. The guests find little to complain about, but the pressure is on for Luke's breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Driftwood bed and breakfast in Weymouth, run by Sarah and Pete Healey. On arrival Cathy and Genice find the place completely ship shape and Lygia spies the host's disco balls.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman and breakfast chef Mary Murray pride themselves on a luxury stay, but emotions run high.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the new “Junior Edition” of MASTERCHEF, America’s top 24 junior home cooks will enter the kitchen for the first time and jump right into their first mystery box challenge. Each junior home cook is tasked with preparing a signature burger and one side. The winner of the challenge will have a significant advantage and will select the main ingredient that the remaining contestants must use in the season’s first elimination round. The junior home cooks with the best dishes will advance in the competition.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the next episode of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR, Season Two winner Logan returns to the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR kitchen and offer some advice to the remaining contestants. The top three contestants from the previous elimination challenge will compete in a cupcake-frosting contest, during which only the winner can keep the judges safe from a sticky situation. Then, in the next challenge, the contestants will be tasked with making a scallop dish in order to move onto the next round in the competition.

programme.desc: The Top 20 junior home cooks face an out-of-this-world Mystery Box challenge with special guest astronaut Tracy Dyson, during which they must prepare a unique dish that highlights a stellar ingredient. The one who rockets to the top will have a significant advantage in the elimination challenge, when the contestants will be tasked with creating a stunning and delicious fish dish in order to move onto the next round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the next episode of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR, the remaining 18 junior home cooks will face their first team challenge of the season and the first-ever MASTERCHEF JUNIOR team relay race. Each team must create a large serving of seven-layer dip. The team that completes the dip first will be safe from the next elimination challenge, and choose the smelly, wrinkly or spicy ingredients for that challenge. Find out who will smell their way to victory and who will dip lower in the competition.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Experience the thrill of fishing in the enchanting waters of the Everglades alongside the renowned Captain Danny Allen and Captain Leiza Fitzgerald. Embark on an unforgettable journey through the intricate maze of mangroves, expansive marshes, and shimmering backwaters, as these expert guides lead you to some of the most coveted fishing spots in the region.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join Captain Danny Allen and Dan Benson from Power-Pole as they embark on an exciting fishing expedition in Cortez, Florida, in the latest installment of Beyond The Surface TV. Witness their relentless pursuit of fish as they adapt to the ever-changing conditions. Don't make the mistake of skipping this captivating episode – it's bound to leave you hooked!

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos chase whitetails in Iowa during the rut at Whiskey Ridge Outfitters.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Everybody is always fighting about does. Should you shoot them? Should you not? Well the teams explains why you're all probably right and wrong in this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode we kick off with calling in a bird for the Bellator Light Heavyweight Champ, Corey Anderson on a farm in Kentucky. We roll up to Ohio and double up on a foggy morning, then it was back to Iowa where John linked up with Skyline Motorsports Crew Chief of the #16 Longhorn, Zeb to chase birds in NE Iowa. Another double to close out the season! 5 turkeys in the episode, Enjoy!!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in Croatia, and on the third day, they decide to venture to the coast where he will pursue his hunt on one of the numerous islands that permit hunting (Dugi Otok Island). Armedwith his trusted Gunwerks 7LRM Rifle, Mark prepares to stalk the diverse array of exotic animals inhabiting these islands, offering him a rich selection of prey to choose from.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is kicking off his North America Deer Slam in the great state of Michigan. Mark cut his teeth in Michigan chasing Whitetails with his dad ever since he was able to walk. Starting this new project focused on deer, it only made sense to launch in his home state of Michigan. With the leaves changing and the rut heating up, Mark hops into one of his favorite stands right off his driveway to try his luck chasing a big Michigan Whitetail.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: The Break
programme.desc: Derek Dirnberger and Joe Hoehn are turkey hunting in southeastMissouri.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Join Nashville songwriter Shane Minor as he heads to the Express UU Bar Ranch in New Mexico in search of a management bull. Learn about Shane's incredible past and present life as he reconnects with his roots in western hunting. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Join Doug Roberts as he selects his newest breeder bucks on the deer farm. Cutting antlers and visiting the annual youth buck pole marks the start of hunting season. Special guest Cody Robins from Live 2 Hunt.

programme.title: Primos

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s non-stop and up-close big bull action as Team Primos kicks off the 2020 season with an early September hunt in New Mexico. Brad Farris drew the long straw this fall and waste no time heading up the mountain with Will Primos dropping back and firing up the Hyper lip double, Hoochie mama and the bullet bugle elk calls.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Jordan “Big Country” Blissett gets in the driver’s seat for some up-close action—and we do mean UP CLOSE! Brad needs plenty of help packing his bull off the mountain, and Lake is down to a precious few days to hunt before heading off for Arizona.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s T-Roy’s turn to get on the board in New Mexico, but Team Primos runs into an all-day affair with a stubborn bull in his own bedroom. How long will this old boy test Troy’s patience as he waits behind his Mathews bow with Will, Jordan and Slade standing by.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: After coaxing in bulls for Troy, Brad, and Jordan, it’s time for Will Primos to go front and center. With Jordan calling, you won’t believe the opportunity Wilbur has when this New Mexico monster makes his presence known!

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: It's lean, delicious, savory and the best part of the hunt. In this episode of Deer and Deer Hunting, Dan Schmidt, Mark Kayser and Brad Fenson share with us their thoughts on the other red meat, venison.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: There's nothing in the world like waking up and hitting the Sweet November woods. That said, make sure you're applying the right hunting tactics for the right time of year.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Hunting the late season is just as exciting as hunting during the rut. As a hunter you have the opportunity to better understand a whitetails needs now that winter has come. In this episode Mark Kayser attempts to fill his Iowa buck tag in December.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Part II of our exclusive profile of the current state of hunting in America and whether or not we believe there is light at the end of the tunnel.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: To kill ducks late season, you need to get off the grid and "FIND THE X". Realtree's Cole Barthel, Kyle Barefield, Stephen McNelly and Producer Matt Garger do exactly that. Hunting Ducks from a boat won't be easy but their struggles are well worth their while.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Georgia Bow Season Opener is finally here and the Road Trip crew is hitting the woods. After months of prep work the guys use the two days before the season to make final adjustments before climbing a tree for the first time this year.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Last season, Black Cloud joined W.E. Phillips at his Duck Club in the Arkansas Timber. W.E. Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The father-son duo of Mike and Sam Crane hunt with Tyler Jordan and Ole Miss football players Eli Acker and Jaxson Dart. The action starts off slow, but the duo got it done late in the morning with a Mississippi double.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Greg Camp heads back to Nebraska for the third year in a row hoping to put his bow tag on a giant 10 Pointer.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew makes a quick trip to Northern Texas and hunt a small farm pond they've had success in in the past. As any duck hunter knows, duck hunts don't always go as planned!!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys at Realtree get together to kick off the 2023-24 Federal Black Cloud waterfowl season. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and friends at Realtree put on an epic early season teal hunt in the Louisiana rice fields.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts Osceola turkeys right outside of Myakka, Florida. After a tough stretch hunting in Mississippi, the crew heads back down to Florida to try to get some momentum going again. After a tough start to the hunt, Jordan is joined by Austin Riley of the Atlanta Braves on a different piece of ground. The hunting was slow overall, but Jordan and Riley did spot a longbeard way off in a cow pasture. The next morning, everything changed and it was a gobbling frenzy. The gobbler ended up walking off with some hens, but they didn't give up. A mid-morning move ended up paying off and the shot was almost missed by the cameraman.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We celebrate the great times we had with the late Capt. Travis Holeman, then look to the future with a renewed passion for adventure and feature highlights from the upcoming season.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Fly-fishing master Meredith McCord joins Capt. Justin Leake and uses unfamiliar tackle to chase tarpon along the beach. Can the veteran fly angler land a silver king on conventional gear? The answer is spectacular!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake takes redfish tournament pro Fred Meyers out of his comfort zone to talk trash and chase tarpon just a few hundred yards off a lively Panama City Beach.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and champion angler Meredith McCord explore public waypoints and attempt to land a world record amberjack on light line. Panama City Beach’s backyard is the site of an epic battle in the first of two amazing episodes.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Renowned angler Meredith McCord and Capt. Justin Leake continue their quest for a line class world record. When struggles begin the moment they leave the dock, grit and lady luck ensure an epic day ends in grand style.

programme.desc: Bucky jumps into the truck heads home from eastern shore to hunt 11 as he shows up on cam but it turns into another surprise.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Matt chases the quiet woods of early-season Colorado and shares a few of his favorite recipes.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: The St. Lawrence River smallmouth can be fickle due to the ultra clear water. JP breaks down his top 3 approaches to fooling them.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With the heart of the rut in full swing all the guys are putting in plenty of hours on stand. With a new bonus buck showing up on the trail cameras everyone is doing everything they can to figure out what his next move will be.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy head to Eagle Lakes Ranch in Washington for their annual duckcation. This year Billy's son Timo is on leave from the Army and is able to make the trip to spend some time hunting hungry mallards.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts one of the biggest bucks on Realtree Farms with his brother Colton. Colton and his Dad Bill, have seen this buck several times over the last few days not he and Tyler make a move hoping to get Colton a shot at this giant Georgia whitetail.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos chase whitetails in Iowa during the rut at Whiskey Ridge Outfitters.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode we kick off with calling in a bird for the Bellator Light Heavyweight Champ, Corey Anderson on a farm in Kentucky. We roll up to Ohio and double up on a foggy morning, then it was back to Iowa where John linked up with Skyline Motorsports Crew Chief of the #16 Longhorn, Zeb to chase birds in NE Iowa. Another double to close out the season! 5 turkeys in the episode, Enjoy!!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in Croatia, and on the third day, they decide to venture to the coast where he will pursue his hunt on one of the numerous islands that permit hunting (Dugi Otok Island). Armedwith his trusted Gunwerks 7LRM Rifle, Mark prepares to stalk the diverse array of exotic animals inhabiting these islands, offering him a rich selection of prey to choose from.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is kicking off his North America Deer Slam in the great state of Michigan. Mark cut his teeth in Michigan chasing Whitetails with his dad ever since he was able to walk. Starting this new project focused on deer, it only made sense to launch in his home state of Michigan. With the leaves changing and the rut heating up, Mark hops into one of his favorite stands right off his driveway to try his luck chasing a big Michigan Whitetail.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Primos

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s T-Roy’s turn to get on the board in New Mexico, but Team Primos runs into an all-day affair with a stubborn bull in his own bedroom. How long will this old boy test Troy’s patience as he waits behind his Mathews bow with Will, Jordan and Slade standing by.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: There's nothing in the world like waking up and hitting the Sweet November woods. That said, make sure you're applying the right hunting tactics for the right time of year.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Hunting the late season is just as exciting as hunting during the rut. As a hunter you have the opportunity to better understand a whitetails needs now that winter has come. In this episode Mark Kayser attempts to fill his Iowa buck tag in December.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Part II of our exclusive profile of the current state of hunting in America and whether or not we believe there is light at the end of the tunnel.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: To kill ducks late season, you need to get off the grid and "FIND THE X". Realtree's Cole Barthel, Kyle Barefield, Stephen McNelly and Producer Matt Garger do exactly that. Hunting Ducks from a boat won't be easy but their struggles are well worth their while.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Georgia Bow Season Opener is finally here and the Road Trip crew is hitting the woods. After months of prep work the guys use the two days before the season to make final adjustments before climbing a tree for the first time this year.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Last season, Black Cloud joined W.E. Phillips at his Duck Club in the Arkansas Timber. W.E. Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The father-son duo of Mike and Sam Crane hunt with Tyler Jordan and Ole Miss football players Eli Acker and Jaxson Dart. The action starts off slow, but the duo got it done late in the morning with a Mississippi double.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Greg Camp heads back to Nebraska for the third year in a row hoping to put his bow tag on a giant 10 Pointer.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew makes a quick trip to Northern Texas and hunt a small farm pond they've had success in in the past. As any duck hunter knows, duck hunts don't always go as planned!!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys at Realtree get together to kick off the 2023-24 Federal Black Cloud waterfowl season. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and friends at Realtree put on an epic early season teal hunt in the Louisiana rice fields.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts Osceola turkeys right outside of Myakka, Florida. After a tough stretch hunting in Mississippi, the crew heads back down to Florida to try to get some momentum going again. After a tough start to the hunt, Jordan is joined by Austin Riley of the Atlanta Braves on a different piece of ground. The hunting was slow overall, but Jordan and Riley did spot a longbeard way off in a cow pasture. The next morning, everything changed and it was a gobbling frenzy. The gobbler ended up walking off with some hens, but they didn't give up. A mid-morning move ended up paying off and the shot was almost missed by the cameraman.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We celebrate the great times we had with the late Capt. Travis Holeman, then look to the future with a renewed passion for adventure and feature highlights from the upcoming season.

programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake takes redfish tournament pro Fred Meyers out of his comfort zone to talk trash and chase tarpon just a few hundred yards off a lively Panama City Beach.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and champion angler Meredith McCord explore public waypoints and attempt to land a world record amberjack on light line. Panama City Beach’s backyard is the site of an epic battle in the first of two amazing episodes.

programme.title: Fireproof

programme.title: Not Easily Broken
programme.desc: A couple's strength and faith are tested after the wife is injured in a car crash and her husband becomes attracted to another woman.

programme.title: I Walk the Line
programme.desc: A sheriff falls in love with a teen whose father is a moonshiner, and falls in danger when as a result, accidentally becomes an accomplice to murder.

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Dreaming of being a famous R&B guitarist, a young virtuoso seeks out a legendary musician and must convince him to teach him the ways of the blues.

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Based on the book The Three Stooges: From Amalgamated Morons to American Icons, this MOW dramatizes the rise of the comedy trio to worldwide fame.

programme.title: The Nuttiest Nutcracker
programme.desc: Young teen Marie falls asleep and enters the magical world of the Nutcracker Prince where, along with some friends, she helps him reclaim his kingdom.

programme.title: Double Platinum
programme.desc: Years after she abandoned her baby girl, a famous singer must face her now teenage daughter and repair their complicated relationship.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: When her plane crashes into a Chicago bridge, ace reporter Gale Gayley is saved by a mysterious and unlikely hero in this heart-warming comedy.

programme.title: Christmas on Division Street
programme.desc: Follows the unlikely friendship between a bullied teenage school boy and the unhomed American history buff he wants to help before Christmas.

programme.title: Fresh Horses
programme.desc: Jewel married a gun-totin' good ol' boy Green, with whom she has ostensibly never had sex. But when she meets rich kid Matt, it's love at first sight.

programme.title: Immediate Family
programme.desc: An upscale couple unable to conceive arrange a brokered adoption with a pregnant woman who doesn’t hold up her end of the deal to give up the baby.

programme.title: Heartsounds
programme.desc: A near-fatal heart attack sends a New York urologist and his writer wife into a battle against a medical institution unable or unwilling to help him.

programme.title: Not Easily Broken
programme.desc: A couple's strength and faith are tested after the wife is injured in a car crash and her husband becomes attracted to another woman.

programme.title: Burlesque
programme.desc: A small-town singer moves to the city for a chance at fame when she finds a glamorous nightclub packed with dancers and an owner in need of a star.

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: Runaway
programme.desc: A futuristic cop who works on broken robots discovers a plan to program them with artificial intelligence for murder, with his own son on the list.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic ‘80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter he’s testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: Baby Blue Marine
programme.desc: A would-be Marine masquerades as a hero by assuming the identity of a real soldier, but, through acts of bravery, becomes a true hero in the end.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew in WWII must contend with thirsty Nazi troops while crossing the Sahara in search of a fabled water well.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Rolling Thunder
programme.desc: To root out evil, a clandestine unit of well-trained warriors combines high-tech know-how and equipment with superior brain power and military might.

programme.title: Into Thin Air: Death on Everest
programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: Lake Placid vs. Anaconda
programme.desc: Get ready for a non-stop bloodbath, unlike anything you've ever seen before in this heart-pounding battle between mutated crocodiles and anacondas.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
programme.desc: Nick Romano (James Darren) lives in a poor tenement building on the south side of Chicago with his well-meaning but drug-addicted mother, Nellie (Shelley Winters). She encourages him to pursue his piano-playing talent in hopes that it will bring him a better life. Nellie's neighbors, like the alcoholic ex-lawyer (Burl Ives) who secretly loves her, help her in keeping Nick away from Louie, the resident drug dealer. But a chance meeting between Nick and Louie could change things forever.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: All the Young Men
programme.desc: After taking command of a Marine platoon during the Korean War, a Black sergeant struggles to rally the white soldiers to complete a critical mission.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Loss of Innocence
programme.desc: Left alone because of their mother's sudden hospitalization during a vacation in France, four British children have to fend for themselves. They stay at a hotel, where, despite the reticence of owner Madame Zisi (Danielle Darrieux), they are befriended by her lover, Eliot (Kenneth More). Joss (Susannah York), the eldest of the children, runs afoul of Madame Zisi, who thinks Eliot is spending too much time with her and causes a scene. Robbed of Eliot's attention, Joss denounces him to the police.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: The prince's quest for revenge becomes his undoing when his suspicion is confirmed that his uncle killed his father to win the throne and his mother.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: There's Always a Woman
programme.desc: An investigator for the district attorney and his amateur sleuth wife compete to solve a murder mystery behind the death of a woman's husband.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy father’s yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: Love Affair
programme.desc: Jim Leonard, a penniless aviator and airplane mechanic, falls in love with the wealthy Carol Owen while giving her flying lessons.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: Picnic
programme.desc: Based on the play by William Inge.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: A stranded group of six Allied soldiers trek across the desert, making their way to an abandoned fort, but are soon faced with a German battalion.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: Knock on Any Door
programme.desc: A young man, a product of skid row, accused of murdering a cop, is defended by a prominent attorney who has known him from childhood.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Thunderhoof
programme.desc: Two men and a young woman in the Mexican wilderness are intent on tracking down a wild stallion.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: Home in San Antone
programme.desc: An innkeeper tries to keep his struggling establishment afloat, unaware that a famous country singer (Roy Acuff) and diamond thieves are staying under his roof.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: The Durango Kid
programme.desc: The cowboy hero (Charles Starrett) with a secret saves settlers from rustlers in his movie-series debut.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: That Texas Jamboree
programme.desc: In 1890, Curt Chambers, the new sheriff of Crescent City, is disgraced when the crooked mayor forces him to shut down a popular medicine show. To save his reputation and a romance, Curt has the medicine tested to prove its value.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Fury at Gunsight Pass
programme.desc: One bank robber (David Brian) double-crosses another (Neville Brand), giving the undertaker and others a chance at the loot.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: The Law vs. Billy the Kid
programme.desc: The notorious gunslinger’s new courtship with a rancher's lovely daughter is cut prematurely short when the law unexpectedly catches up with him.

programme.title: Thunderhoof
programme.desc: Two men and a young woman in the Mexican wilderness are intent on tracking down a wild stallion.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: Home in San Antone
programme.desc: An innkeeper tries to keep his struggling establishment afloat, unaware that a famous country singer (Roy Acuff) and diamond thieves are staying under his roof.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: The Fabric of Christmas
programme.desc: Liam, a fireman, and Amy, a quilting teacher, team up to make a Christmas quilt for Liam's sister.

programme.title: Waking Up to Christmas
programme.desc: After being zapped by faulty Christmas lights, a workaholic finds herself the lead in an over-the-top Hallmark-style holiday movie.

programme.title: His & Her Christmas
programme.desc: Tom Lane is the star columnist for the media conglomerate owned San Francisco Sun newspaper. The company is thinking about increasing Tom's exposure by producing a new television show around him. Liz Madison is the advice columnist for the little read community newspaper, the Marin County Voice, which is a throwback to gentler times. Besides their journalistic occupations, one other similar aspect between Tom and Liz is that they are both currently single, with their friends and family doing whatever they can to find that special someone for their personal life. On November 2, the staff at the Voice learn that the Sun ownership has bought their newspaper, with the probable goal of folding it into the operations of the Sun. If this move does happen, the staff at the Voice will lose their jobs. To fight back, Liz decides to change her column to an editorial espousing the meaning of Christmas and the newspaper to the community.

programme.title: Hearts Under the Olive Tree
programme.desc: Looking for inspiration for her next fantasy book, a renowned author is taken to a farmland retreat, where something even more magical awaits.

programme.title: Bones
